title: Ekko active ult small change..
body:
i was thinking about a little change to {{champion:245}} the broken timeline active on his ult. 

I know some will disagree but this is my opinion 

still the same but with something extra below in bold

Ekko turns back time, going briefly untargetable and invulnerable. He teleports to where he was 4 seconds ago and deals --- magic damage to nearby enemies on arrival. Additionally, Ekko heals for ---, increased by ---% for each 1% of his health lost over the last 4 seconds. **If enemy champions are inside and get hit by his chronobreak their resistances after impact get decreased by 3/4/5% for 2 seconds.** 

something like that

I know he is getting some love next patch and it seems biased since i main him and I'm not complaining about him, but honestly i would give this a shot to see how it goes. I've been thinking about it.. maybe its abit much and over tuned or whatever but in a way it would be nice to give him that bonus for providing a good ult on the enemy and if Ekko uses it to escape situations you don't get it of course its basically normal thats if no-ones in it. 

share thoughts below!

replies.body:
that honestly just feels like the least impactful thing they could give him. 
How about instead, reduce the Magic damage Ap ratio on his ult by 40% and the base damage by 100, but have his ult zone proc his passive on targets if they have at least 1 stack of his passive. This shifts his ult into more of an offensive ability rather than a panic button. 

Since he'll now be getting 60-80% bonus movespeed for 2.5-3s, and a bonus 80-140 base damage on his ult as well as 80% AP ratio, which can really  help if Ekko is using his ult offensively.

Now Ekko has a higher AP ratio on his ult and slightly better base damage, and a burst of movespeed to reposition, provided that he's hit any of the targets in it's explosion radius.

I 100% agree i think it should proc with atleast 1 stack aswell, it will give the ult the burst it needs.. squishes would be short work like always but better and easier and it can really change a fight for Ekko's team. its like take the risk and it might pay off vibe.
